N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 637.2 - Conditions for reimbursement for food stamp costs

State Regulations
(a) Costs related to the provision of food
stamps to eligible individuals which are required to be allocated or
distributed by regulation or direction of the department shall be claimed as
required by such regulations or directions. Costs shall be allocated or
distributed in accordance with the requirements set forth in department
regulations pertaining to the allocation of expenditures for public assistance
and care. (b) Except as otherwise
directed by the department, amounts expended for food stamp activities, including enforcement and fraud detection activities, for which an enhanced
rate of Federal participation may be claimed by the department shall be claimed
by the district in a manner that will result in the receipt of such additional

Federal participation. Such enhanced reimbursement shall be treated in a manner
that permits the State to claim the greatest amount of Federal participation
for a local district's food stamp activity expenditures which are reimbursed by
the State. (c) Except as otherwise
specifically authorized by Federal or State law or regulation or as
specifically directed by the department, no amounts for food stamp expenditures
shall be reimbursable if such amounts were paid directly to the individual
eligible to receive food stamps or such individual's representative. (d) Any adjustment of claims for
reimbursement, including adjustment to claims as a result of recoveries or
collections, shall be made in accordance with procedures, instructions or
directions of the department. (e) Amounts claimed as food stamp expenditures shall be reduced in accordance with
instructions of the department to reflect any penalty or other charges accruing
to the district. (f) Any claims for
reimbursement for food stamp expenditures which were not fully reimbursed as
claimed and which were properly made at the time they were originally claimed, may be reclaimed pursuant to this Part, provided that the revised claim is
timely and an adjustment is simultaneously submitted to the department to
reduce the original claim. Notes
